projects.name: Helmsman AI-Augmented Task Management
projects.description: Transform the basic task management system into a sophisticated AI-powered personal command center with energy-aware scheduling, intelligent task extraction, dependency management, and contextual assistance. Implements the complete Helmsman specification with enhanced Prisma schema, OpenAI integration, daily planning algorithm, and accessibility-compliant UI components.

tasks.name: Enhance Prisma schema with Helmsman metadata fields
tasks.details:
Update the existing Prisma schema to support all Helmsman specification requirements including energy levels, focus types, task priorities, deadlines, dependencies, and user settings. This foundational change enables intelligent scheduling and AI-powered task management.

Files to modify:
- backend/prisma/schema.prisma: Add new enums (EnergyLevel, FocusType, TaskSource), extend Task model with metadata fields, create UserSettings model, add InteractionLog model for Mem0 integration
- backend/src/tasks/dto/: Create new DTOs for enhanced task creation/updates with metadata validation
- backend/src/users/dto/: Add UserSettings DTOs for energy patterns and preferences

Key schema additions:
- Task.energyLevel (enum: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH)
- Task.focusType (enum: CREATIVE, TECHNICAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, SOCIAL) 
- Task.estimatedMinutes (integer, nullable)
- Task.priority (integer 1-5, default 3)
- Task.softDeadline and Task.hardDeadline (DateTime, nullable)
- Task.source (enum: SELF, BOSS, TEAM, AI_GENERATED)
- Task.aiSuggestion (text, nullable)
- UserSettings model with morningEnergyLevel, afternoonEnergyLevel, preferredWorkHours
- InteractionLog model for Mem0 context storage

Migration strategy: Add fields as nullable first, backfill with defaults, then apply constraints. This ensures zero-downtime deployment while maintaining data integrity for existing tasks.

tasks.name: Create data migration to backfill task metadata
tasks.details:
Create safe data migration scripts to backfill existing tasks with sensible defaults for the new metadata fields. This ensures all existing user data remains functional while gaining the benefits of enhanced scheduling.

Create backfill script in backend/prisma/scripts/backfill-task-metadata.ts:
- Set energyLevel = MEDIUM for all existing tasks (safe neutral default)
- Set focusType = ADMINISTRATIVE for existing tasks (conservative default)
- Set priority = 3 for all existing tasks (middle priority)
- Set source = SELF for all existing tasks (user-created assumption)
- Leave deadlines and aiSuggestion as null (no assumptions about timing)
- Preserve all existing task data (title, description, completed, dueDate, etc.)

Verification steps:
- Count tasks before/after migration to ensure no data loss
- Verify all non-nullable fields have values
- Test that existing API endpoints continue to work
- Create rollback script to remove new fields if needed

Run backfill after schema migration but before applying NOT NULL constraints. Include comprehensive logging and progress tracking for large datasets.

tasks.name: Implement energy-aware daily planning algorithm
tasks.details:
Implement the core daily planning algorithm that generates optimized schedules based on task metadata, user energy patterns, dependencies, and time constraints. This is the heart of the Helmsman intelligent scheduling system.

Create backend/src/planning/daily-planner.service.ts with:
- Task scoring algorithm considering priority, deadlines, energy match, focus batching
- Energy-aware scheduling that matches high-energy tasks to morning slots
- Dependency resolution to ensure blocked tasks aren't scheduled
- Time slot generation based on user preferences and existing commitments
- Focus type batching for cognitive efficiency (group similar work)
- Overcommitment detection and task deferral logic

Algorithm components:
- calculateTaskScore(task, timeSlot, userSettings): scoring function
- resolveTaskDependencies(tasks): filter out blocked tasks
- generateTimeSlots(date, userSettings, commitments): available time windows
- assignTasksToSlots(tasks, slots): greedy assignment with optimization
- OptimizationResult with energyOptimization and focusOptimization scores

API endpoint: GET /api/plans/today?date=YYYY-MM-DD
Returns DailyPlan with scheduleBlocks, unscheduledTasks, optimization metrics

Include comprehensive unit tests with various scenarios: normal day, overcommitted, all tasks blocked, empty schedule, user with different energy patterns.

- Energy level match (20%): HIGH=20pts, MEDIUM=15pts, LOW=10pts  
- Focus type efficiency (10%): CREATIVE/TECHNICAL=8pts, ADMINISTRATIVE=6pts, SOCIAL=10pts

âœ… **Score Normalization**: Ensures return values stay within 0-100 range as specified

tasks.name: Implement security hardening and audit logging
tasks.details:

Create backend/src/security/rate-limiting.middleware.ts:
- Redis-based rate limiting with different limits per endpoint type
- AI endpoints: 10 requests/minute (expensive operations)
- Task operations: 60 requests/minute (standard CRUD)
- Authentication endpoints: 5 requests/minute (prevent brute force)
- Rate limit headers in responses (X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining)

Implement audit logging in backend/src/security/audit-logger.service.ts:
- Log all task modifications with user ID, action, and changes
- Track AI interactions with input/output sanitization
- Record authentication events and permission changes
- Structured logging with correlation IDs for tracing
- Retention policy and log rotation

Data encryption service in backend/src/security/encryption.service.ts:
- Encrypt sensitive data at rest (AI suggestions, user preferences)
- Use AES-256-GCM with proper key management
- Environment-based encryption keys with rotation support
- Encrypt/decrypt methods with proper error handling

Security headers middleware:
- CORS configuration for production domains

tasks.name: Design Calendar Architecture and ADHD UX Patterns

tasks.name: Implement Drag-and-Drop Task Scheduling
